Since I was driving...no alcohol drinks but went with the Fresh Strawberry Mango Cooler and my sister went with a Shirley Temple.  Great place for groups and family, definitely coming back here again for their Avocado club egg rolls.

You can never go wrong at cpk! Came here for lunch and it wasn't busy at all. We got seated immediately and our server was really nice. I came in a party of 4, and we ordered the Thai BBQ chicken pizza, Thai crunch salad, lettuce wraps and a veggie sandwich. I tried a little bit of everything and we all agreed we made great decisions on our meals!! Love the bottomless refills! Great place for a quick lunch with friends!  Xo,  Naomi

first time at CPK. we had a server named Alfonso and he took good care of us even when we became very needy. the restaurant have good food in big portions. enough for 2 people to share. pizza was okay, not the best, but the pastas were definitely delish!

Customer service and food are consistently excellent! We usually order the Thai pizza, the Hawaiian BBQ Chicken, and works pizzas. If you like artichoke dip, this place has the best dip!! Patio seating is nice. They are currently renovating the flooring in the main dining room so it looks a bit messy. Otherwise great experience.

California Pizza Kitchen use to be really good & my family's favorite pizza place but they have recently gone downhill. I came to this locations about a week ago with my boyfriend. We asked the server how big the pizzas were because it has been a few years since i've been here. She said they were pretty big and big enough for us to share one. We took her word and ordered 1 pizza to share. When she brought it out, we were confused because the pizza was really small. It had 6 small slices & it was more of an appetizer than a meal. Their crust use to be thick but the pizza that she had brought out, had really really thin crust. So thin that the pizza was falling apart when we picked up our slices, it was also really greasy. Their pizzas aren't the same anymore sadly.  Our bill ended up being $40 which was ridiculous. I didn't even get a drink, I just ordered a glass of water. My boyfriend got lemonade and he also ordered a small appetizer. So basically $40 for a tiny pizza, appetizer and 1 drink? we felt extremely ripped off and we weren't full at all. We left hungry and ended up making something to eat at home. We could have gone to round table, dominoes or pizza hut for better quality pizza for less than half of the price

I wish the service was better. We had our appetizers served, but no silverware, plates, & napkins. We had to keep reminding our waitress Renee about the stuff she kept forgetting. She also left all of our finished plates on the table. They were obviously stacked and ready to be picked up. There was a nice waiter who walked by and saw and apologized for it not being picked up. The pepperoni pizza was good, & the tiramisu was delicious.

Gave it 2 stars because the service was pretty good but I have to say that I was actually dissapointed with the pizza. After just half a slice I was wishing I had gone to bjs or pieology. Probably will never return here because there was nothing that stood out as great.

I visited the ventura location about two weeks ago and had the new chicken and veggie plate, service was ok, but the food was phenomenal.  My boyfriend and I came to the Victoria Gardens location hoping to get the same great flavors...and we did! Not just that but the service was excellent!  The manager came by with a free flat bread since it was our first time at this location,  also very tasty. The avocado rolls here are really good too. Highly recommend the the new chicken and veggie entrée. Can't remember the name, but it's soo good. My boyfriend tried the halibut,  also good! These items hit the menu next week according to our server. We'll definitely be back!

I've come to this CPK for over a decade and have loved being a regular. Love sitting at the bar more so than the restaurant portion, however, this has now changed. The remodel to this location is stiff. The bar chairs are hard to get into and highly uncomfortable. The chairs for the short tables are the cousin to the uncomfortable bar chairs and are just as bad.  Not sure how corporate thought this was a smart redesign, but I think customers will be unhappy with the chairs and won't want to sit in them. I don't and will ask for booth seating from here on out.  Food is still awesome as is customer service. Overall the remodel looks very nice, but it isn't practical. I emailed the CEO of CPK because he asks for open communication from customers, but I haven't heard back from him in 3 weeks.

The remodel looks great! I've always loved coming to this location and I've never been disappointed. Mary was my bartender at the bar and she was great! Always telling me when she would be back and if I needed anything else. Very friendly and bubbly and I love that! She makes a mean platinum margarita! Great job Mary

I give this location five stars. My boyfriend and I went on 5/7/15 as it was our first visit. We were kindly greeted and seated by Kara. Our waitress was Jacob whom kindly gave us his time to welcome us and explain about what's popular on the menu. It took us a bit of time to order because we were so indecisive; everything looked so good! Next thing you know, if I remember, Jeremy, the GM I believe, came out and welcomed us for our first visit and gave us an appetizer on the house! Never have we, let alone myself been welcomed like that before! It was a great and welcoming feeling. Anyways we went on and ordered our food and everything was delicious! I highly recommend coming back here and ask for Jacob as your waitress; he is awesome!

Great place to eat! I recommend eating outside. Ironically, I have never tried their pizza. However, their chicken avocado egg rolls are a MUST! Very impressed and glad to know they have more than pizza to choose from.

The best thin crust pizza in all the IE! Always eating out here with my girlfriend and every time the customer service is very good, if your a first timer they always give you a free flat cheese bread to give you an idea about how they care for their customers!

I have dined here several times in the past year but have not enjoyed the food as much as I did tonight.  They have a new item called garlic chicken with grilled seasonal vegetables and fingerling potatoes.  Wow this dish was packed with flavor no disappointments here. My personal preference would have been garlic mashed potatoes but the fingerlings were very good everything grilled to perfection.  Our server was attentive and familiar with menu items.
My first time here. Server Pahola and Mgr Jacob were awesome.   You could tell that Pahola enjoys her job and is people oriented.  Pizza was great and gluten free.  Keep up the good work.

The 5 stars are for the awesome staff! One of the hostess at the front was so sweet and polite when seating us. She asked how we were doing and had a quick little convo with my husband and I. I didn't catch her name but she made us smile with her warm personality. Now on to our waitress, Cassie. She was very sweet as well and took great care of us. Our food came out quickly (mind you it was a busy Friday night). She was very attentive to our needs and checked in on us often. Side note, I'm 9 months pregnant and she asked when I was due, I told her I was a week late and going in to have my baby tomorrow. She was so nice and said congrats and asked a few questions, which was nice and genuine. When we were handed the check she said good luck and the bill also shad good luck written on it. It was very nice to have great service from someone with a smiling face and from someone who genuinely cares about (basically, a persons she's never met). I found these two women to be great at their job and we'll be back again! Thanks Cassie! Great service all around!

Literally just got sat and am very disappointed at the service already. The hostess, Cassandra, sat a different party instead of us as she mispronounced both parties' names but didn't bother to double check. She was also incredibly rude as she came back and was laughing, making fun of my name as she read it off the wait list. I was literally 3 feet away waiting. She realized it was me and did not even apologize as she sat us then left. GREAT first impression of the restaurant.
I only ordered a salad but it was a decent size, delicious, and not pricey at all. Our server was amazing!! John is probably the best server I've ever come across.

Descent CPK location, though it can get really crowded and the food is not really worth the wait. Prices are a bit high for the quality you get, well I do enjoy some of the apps, they are really not much better than at any other chain restaurants. I do like their salads, though they are by no means healthy, but tasty and filling. The pizzas are pretty small and pricey and not any better than the ones you can buy at the grocery store, pass on that next time (though isn't that what is suppposed to be  THE thing to get here?!!)  Not really wowed by our dinner here, not worth going out of my way to come back for.

My wife dragged me here and I was surprised how quality pizza they were serving.  Little loud because this place is always packed, and this is understandable.  the servers were handling the crowds quiet well, and we got our delicious foods on timely manner.  Definitely A+ restaurant for clean environment, quality foods, and good management. If you people didn't like this restaurant, you are probably extremely picky on every other restaurants.

Came here today surprised with the new renovation and a new vibe their surroundings weren't the only thing changed. The menu has changed a bit as well added new foods and prices went a up I got to say I'm a bit disappointed when I found out that my favorite desert has been taken off :( the best tiramisu I've ever had and I guess ever will not only is it my favorite but my families and many friends
This place used to be great.  Service and management have definitely declined.    Especially management,  hid out in the kitchen the whole time.   Numerous tables including ours were having issues.
Consistently good. I like the remodel as well. BBQ chicken salad and a Margherita pizza. Just right. Good service as well.

Came here today with my best friend and our moms for lunch we planned on grabbing a bite for heading to the airport. By our surprise it took an extremely unusually long amount of time to receive our food so I spoke with the manager about it and our food came and she comped our meal. I thought that was very nice so we will definitely come back. Excellent customer service from manager Jenn!

Rolled up to have some drinks with friends. We got drink and some food the server was great. For got his name. He had to leave early so we payed out with him and he was on his way. I wanted another drink I waited about 10 min no other server came over to ask if we needed anything or to clear our table. I actually got up and walked to bar ordered my drink and sat  back down. We waited an additional 20 min before I had to flag a manager Down to clear our table. She apologized . Funny enough she was the same person who walked pass our table and made no attempt to clear it. Other then that it was good.

Pros:  -food is good the spinach artichoke dip was heavenly  -bread was good olive oil was supreme -waitress referred to us as her "friend"  -split our check  -ambience was very relaxing -restrooms were clean Cons: -wait was not heavenly I could've taken a short nap -my pizza had a salad on it -they messed up our order -avocado was not ripe :-(((
The pizza was ok. But the service was horrible. I am very disappointed. I ended up going to a different pizza place due to this bad experience, never again!
Extremely slow service. Waited over an hour for food. Will never come back. Waiter was extremely rude!!!

A huge bug in my salad..I would give it -5 if I could!  My first time at CPK and we sat at the bar took 15 min to get a menu another 15 to get someone to come back and take our order. A total of 45 min of waiting for food to come out (we are patient people). Two bites in to our Cesar salad we see a 1inch cricket just chilling in Cesar salad dressing. I just about vomited on the bar. It is evident that they do not wash their lettuce before serving it, putting all customers at risk.  -Disgusted and infuriated.

I was so happy that we chose CPK for date night last Saturday night! Our experience there was amazing!! The wait time was very short, the food and drinks were great, and our server went above and beyond for us.  Our server,  John M., was so friendly, energetic, enthusiastic, and attentive. He made great suggestions, he kept us updated on our order, and he made sure that we had everything that we needed. It was such a pleasure to have John M. as our server because he was like the life of the party as well as the perfect host. We really appreciated the amazing experience that John M. created for us. He is the reason I am leaving such a great review, so thank you again John M.! CPK is lucky to have you!!

Unfortunately, this review is about the poor service.  CPK has revamped the menu and the inside has also changed.  CPK added new floors, tables, chair, and a semi-redesign of the place. However, what really needed to be updated was the service.  Servers were slow, delayed, and not up to par.  The manager was walking around but never came to our table to ask us how our experience was.  Food was solid but hard to enjoy your food without the right condiments, bread, or sauces.   Sorry, but 2-stars and hope they fix this problem of bad service.

Food is always amazing here but it's the people that differentiates this CPK from the rest. The manager here is so personal and makes sure you have a pleasurable experience. We ordered shots of tequila and after seeing our faces she brought over a sample of her favorite along with a cute story about the start of casa migos tequila! Keep up the good work Rancho CPK! And thanks again

The manager is such a lovely person ahe came and introduced herself and evem gave us a free entree for it being our first time. Andy our server was not attentive at all. He didnt refil our drinks we had to get the manager to do it. The food was great and the mojitos are delicious.
Food was good and it had great service. The only thing though was the menu was a bit small and what I mean is that there's not a lot of choices to pick from.

Went on a Saturday after I got off work, it was just before 10pm (they close at 11) it was just me and my boyfriend. We walked in and were pretty much ignored by they hostesses, they seemed to be more worried about the highchairs being cleaned and restrooms being done. All while cleaning solution is out on the hostess table in plain veiw, what if a child walked up and squirted himself in the eye or drank some?  When she does realize we have been waiting for more the 15minutes she asked if we were already helped. And goes on to say , well you know you need to let us know you want to be put on the list. Just ..... Wow . I gave her a quipped response and that was that.  After all that we got seated outside by the swinging door that was opened every 30 seconds , so we took it upon ourselves to move to a quieter spot.  Our waiter John was AMAZING he totally turned out night around! He was funny and energetic which is really refreshing at 10:30 at night when you know they are closing.  The food was delicious! I ordered the spicy southwest chicken pizza and Danny ordered the works pizza with pineapple added on. (We really loved that they don't put pineapple bits but instead put sliced pineapple on! ) we got desserts after and can complain about those either. $60 well spent. The pizza tasted awesome the next day too :)

The first time my girlfriend and I visited it was open with a well designed rustic feel. We were greeted and seated quickly. And I don't want to get into depth about how amazing the food was from beginning to end because this would become a novel.

Manager was so nice and gave us a free app for our first time eating there! Wonder if they would do that for a homeless who just went in for something cheap. Food for thought! The place is clean and I never went without help. Definitely recommend going here for your pizza!

CPK Happy Hour is at 3pm. Came in 2:40 at the bar. Waitress says have to wait 20 min for Happy Hour. OK no problems we ordered pizza & ate. Watching the clock ticking waiting for 3pm. Tick-Tock!... 3:05 Tick-Tock! ....3:10...It is way past Happy Hour now...The Bar is empty & the restaurant not crowded, still only waiting. Waitress/bartender has vanished. The bartender is also a restaurant server so lots of waiting & very slow service here. Wikipedia says "The words "happy" and "hour" have appeared together for centuries when describing pleasant times" Well, at this CPK location there is nothing pleasant served during Happy hour. Only waiting for a century to be served!
First time here and I love this place the soups are delicious as well goes with the pizza !!!

Kinda bitchy receptionist. Almost walked out to eat at another resto but we were so damn hungry plus my hubby has been bugging me to try the ribeye.  Friday night plus crazy number of people because of the christmas tree. Don't expect outside seating. We were told we had to wait for 1 to 1.5 hours.  We were called for a table inside after only 30 mins.  Good thing this bad service was salvaged by our very nice server.  Bread with olive oil: hard and not tasty Ribeye: yummy with butter sauce. Good sides. Big portion.  Pizza: so so. Seriously dominoe's has better thin crust mushroom sausage pizza.  Pasta: tasty but portion is kinda small compared to cheesecake. Side note their parmesan cheese is good.  Spinach dip: very good Fried mac and cheese: good order for small plate   I told my husband this is why I never eat at CPK. There is always a feeling of disappointment. But, I will go back for thr ribeye

Slow, rude and food is meh. Servers obviously have a better place to be than serving us. It was Monday, there were 2-3 other tables present, they obviously weren't busy just really uninterested. Would not come again. Definitely not worth the $60 we paid. Should have gone to the Cheesecake Factory.
Love this place. Our server Nichole Maupin is amazing,  our meals were delivered quick, our drinks never went empty.  Great and amazing experience. :)

I received 100$giftcard So I order some meals by phone and decided what we were going to buy using the menu from the official website. We ordered the habenero pizza but we did not receive it because the employees said that they no longer make it. If it is no longer available then why was is it still on the website? Plus, we also ordered the jambalaya but it tasted very unexpectedly terrible and old. Adding to all this, the employees were extremely rude to us. The remodeling of the place was good, but it is far more better to "renovate" your employees instead.

Went with a party of six to celebrate a birthday. Most everyone seemed to like their meals but mine was a very poor value. The bbq chicken sandwich sounded great and might have been so but for the noticeable absence of said chicken. It had 3-count 'em-small chunks of chicken snide the slaw and onion strings Overall a steep price for a bread sandwich
Terrible service. Took an hour to get chicken lettuce wraps. Had to practically beg for napkins and utensils. Just basic service seemed to be a struggle.

Date night at Victoria Gardens! Let's just say I can understand the negative reviews here. We walked on over here before the midnight release of the new Hunger Games movie, only because the wait for Lucile's was too long and my man is like literally always craving pizza. There was no wait here (hmm got me wondering) and we were seated right away. Unfortunately we weren't brought drinks or menus for a good 15 minutes. There were only about 4 tables and a few servers around so I was baffled. It only gets worse as the female serving us was very preoccupied with chatting it up with her homies at the next table, obviously distressed about having to work that night. Our food was good though. Sadly I had to chase her down for refills as she was going out of her way to avoid us. I only come to CPK for the California Club pizza, ohmagawd it's amazing but not worth getting the run around with bad service.

On the way back from Las Vegas visiting my sister in the hospital, we got hungry and my aunt knew of this area. I was completely excited since I haven't been to California Pizza Kitchen in years.  Sadly, they didn't have the Tandoori Chicken pizza that I always order. The receptionist was nice, it was a Sunday night, and people were waiting.  We got seated 15-20 minutes, just like the receptionist advised. I was so tired from driving back and forth from LA to Las Vegas that I got a drink, and I actually got carded!  Our waitress was so nice.  She came to check on us to make sure we were doing well, and she came around to check on us just at the right timing.  Not too often and we never had to flag her down. For being under 20, I think she had a great work ethic as well as being kind and nice.  All in all great experience.

This was our first time here and can say it was great!!! Good ambience and presentation of drinks and food.  We had the opportunity to be helped by our waitress named Sam. She was pleasant, fun, and recommended a few items.  They even brought us out a complementary dish as a appetizer being it was our first time out to their location.  We will be back and re commend this establishment to anyone looking for a good spot with a good variety of food and scenery.  I had the rib eye which was cooked to perfection and the wife had the veggie pizza which was also delicious.  Thanks everyone at CPK!!!!

I like the CPK chain, but what makes or breaks a restaurant is the staff. First, the petite woman at the front desk was just rude and unwelcoming. And the server was not someone I would ever want to wait on me again. Her personality was a bit phony & off-putting but she grabbed things from the table that I was still using. She asked my friend if she was done her meal, and barely getting a yes, she grabbed her plate and everything BUT mine. I was still using the oil for my bread, but she whisked it away. Also, I don't tend to like servers who say, "Have WE decided?" "How are WE doing?" etc. It's just yuk.

My 4 year old son said this is the worst pizza ever and I have to agree. My food came out cold and flavorless. The pizza tasted like cardboard. I dought I will ever be back. The service was horrible. Had to ask for refills and server just took forever. My glass was dirty. I can just go on and on. I rather just say eat somewhere else.
Food and service were great! The avocado rolls and Italian chopped salad were excellent... Will be back

Always have great service at CPK. I LOVE THE LUNCH SPECIAL! The salads are huge, enough for two or you can get a half salad which is perfect fora quick lunch.  I like that they are kid friendly and it too noisy. I've never been disappointed in anything I've ordered and love to bring friends.

A little disappointed in our service here. I think we either got a new server or an overwhelmed server. Had to ask for napkins and never received utensils although we ended up not needing them. Never received the water I asked for and one of the orders was wrong. She even admitted to making the same mistake earlier. Our Thai pizza was lacking something. Have definitely been to better locations. Will give this place another chance.

I took my mother in law to CPK yesterday. We ordered the Kung Pao Pasta with no meat and the grilled veggie salad and split it between the two. My 3.5 year old loved the bread and olive oil dip. We had to order a second batch because it was so good. The Kung Pao pasta was absolutely delicious! The salas as good too. We'll definitely go back again and try other stuff on the menu. By the way, I read a previous comment from someone on the bread being hard and yes it's hard, but it's meant to be hard, it's a baguette! It's meant to be a little hard.
Amazing staff!!! But food got my friends and I sick. We all had something different as well. Based on how sick I feel right now I won't be going back anytime soon. Food poisoning

Stopped in because I won a gift card at a Christmas work party.  I was reminded why we don't make CPK a regular dinner spot.  Their food and drinks are EXTREMELY over priced.   My husband and I shared a full Chinese Chicken Salad ($15.29) and a California Club Pizza ($14.59) as well as a Coconut Blossom ($9.99) from the bar and a Coke and an iced tea.  The salad was a good portion and definitely shareable, but the pizza was 90% dough and arugula.  There was very little by way of other toppings on the pizza.  Totally not worth the price.  Also, by Coconut Blossom was full of ICE!  Maybe 3 good sized drinks and then just a full glass of ice with some pineapple were left.  Also, NOT WORTH THE PRICE.   There are plenty of other restaurants that will give you more bang for your buck in Victoria Gardens.  I would not bother to come here again and if given a gift card, I would try and trade it with someone for something else.

Very disappointed at the poor service we received tonight. After making the order, we waited for about 40 minutes later to find out that they misplaced the order.  Not only they failed to inform us of the delay, they were very rude too. They didn't even apologize for this poor service as well.  We definitely not going there any more.

I got a pepperoni pizza and it just wasn't very good. Very greasy with little flavor. The restaurant was pretty empty yet our service wasn't very good at all. Our waiter was forgetting stuff and overall serviced just seemed a little off. Probably won't go back.

I Took My Girlfriend Last Week Here For The First Time And It Was Great ! Alex Was Very Helpful In Helping Me Select Not Only A Great IPA But And Amazing Pizza As Well I Will Definitely Be Taking My Girl Here More Often !

It took about 45 min to place our order when the place was practically empty. When we finally did place our order it took another 30-35min to get to our table. Food was good, service needs improvement.

Did not have a great experience as we have before. Husband, baby and I came in for dinner around 7:15. With a 15 minute wait, my husband went to bar for a drink, but they did not have the liquor he asked for in stock so he had to wait for her to get it from the back. Once sat, we received our bread promptly and water, but our drinks took at least 10-15 minutes- again out of Grey Goose so after waiting 10 min finally changed order. Second drink was asked for neat, and it had ice in it. Small salad took about 20 minutes to receive and then by the time our order was out it was another 15-20 minutes later for 2 pastas and a thai chicken pizza. We could see many other tables looking around for their food too. After talking with a manager we only received a 20% discount - a measly $10.00 - which didn't even comp one entree. Overpriced for the amount of time and poor service we received. Not sure we'll come back.

Fuck this guy named John he's a total ass and he's sassy as hell, he's totally unprofessional idk how he got a friggen job here. I think he saw me type this review and now he's being a kiss ass. His attitude makes me not wanna come back here till he's fired or quits

Came in with a party of 11 with children and were seated right away. I ordered the Sicilian Pizza which was awesome. The rest of the party ordered kids pizza, Cobb salad, shrimp scampi, etc. The food came up relatively quick and delivered to everybody in our party at the same time. Our server was very attentive and very interested in taking care of us. Average cost for adults was under $20 for food and drink. They also have a children's menu with a variety of meal choices.
Went for a date night with my hubby. Good pizza. Good salad. Peach tea is sweet and yummy. Service was a little slow.

This is a great place for lunch on a nice sunny day or a cool summer evening out for dinner. The food is good and the service is great. The outdoor seating is a nice spot for a good meal on a nice mall outing.
Great night here from our host Richard to our server Doug, very friendly even on a busy night we will be back for sure.

Started off Horribly... With a grumpy and rude "Malia" at the host stand... At 12 noon on a Tuesday, the restaurant was at most 25% full, with 75% of tables open... The front lobby had 15+ people waiting for tables and she informed us rudley it would be a 10-15 min wait...  Once we finally got a table, our food was great... But seriously, first impressions are everything, and this is a SERVICE INDUSTRY... FIGURE IT OUT!
give tina a raise she was the best waitress ever no gas highkey really good service and is really funny

It started off not so well, with sitting at bar counter, which was dirty the entire way around, but told to go ahead and sit. The counter was cleared of items here and there, but not where we were sitting and not wiped down anywhere, ok, they r busy. Another single person sat down a couple of seats over and we all sat there for some time, again. When the bar tender took their order and didn't even look at us, we were done. We went back up to the front desk, where we had put our name in, then they were able to seat us quickly.  The manager brought us a comp appetizer and appologized for how things started out. My husbands dish came with spice balls on it that weren't stated on menu,  so they had to remake it and were able to expidite so didn't take too long, again, the maneger made sure if that. Our waiter Michael was really good and Ialso went to the maneger to make this happen, so they did a great job overall. The pizza is amazing,  as I don't care for a lot of sauce or any at all.

Been craving barbecue chicken pizza lately so had to stop by CPK today. Hubby and I made it in time for the lunch duo which is a great value. He had pizza and soup. I ordered the pizza and Caesar salad combo. We also ordered a chicken lettuce wrap appetizer to share. We left feeling full and satisfied. Our server was a gem. Very sweet and efficient!
Was at this CPK location just lastnight and i found  a hair in my food which was very gross. Very unsatisfied check your food people.

CPK is my go to if I want a nice lunch/dinner with consistency. The service here is always great, the staff is always so nice and friendly, and the food is always what I expect. I always order the pear Gorgonzola pizza and my husband always gets the tequila fettuccini. They give you just the right amount to make you feel satisfied but not overly full. We usually follow our meal with a nice walk around Victoria gardens and sometimes a movie.

We went out for a family dinner. Unfortunately, instead of being able to eat as a family, we ended up eating at separate times because the service was terrible. My mom and my pasta had to be sent back because it was very salty. The drinks came out very late and was incorrect, and there was a bug in my water. The cups were dirty, and the water had floaties in it (in spite of having to ask for a different cups of water). The manager came by and apologized for the bad food and explained that they have to salt the water every 30 minutes, and we must have gotten a freshly salted batch. Eventually, after my dad has finished his meal, the waitress brought out our entrees. If the first plates saltiness factor was an 9/10, then this new plate was an 8/10. Not wanting to wait another hour of poor service, we just bagged the food and ordered a pizza to split between me and my mom. After all this and a few apologies for dirty cups, dirty water, super salty food, no refills, late drinks, and an overall disappointing experience, not one cent of our meal was comped. I'm pretty sure she even over charged us extra for a refill for a soft drink. What we wanted as a special night out as a family to celebrate ended up being a disappointing disaster. I will never spend another penny in this establishment. For a corporation, this night was unacceptable on many levels. Save your money. Go to one of the countless number of restaurants in the area if you plan on trying to have an enjoyable night.

Came to Victoria Gardens to go see the Jungle Book and with the intentions of eating at Johnny Rockets. Johnny rockets was a 25 min wait so we decided to explore different options and that is how we stumbled upon California Pizza Kitchen. This was our first time here and once we got in we were greeted by the Hostesses. We were told a 25 min wait as well which was fine because they were busy. We put our name down and we waited. After about 10 mins we found a seat at the bar and were greeted upon instantly. Everything from there was excellent. The bartender lady was super nice and friendly and we got our drinks and bread right away. I ended up getting the Hawaiian Pizza and my husband got the Caesar Salad and Fettuccine pasta with shrimp. All of our food was amazing and I liked how light the pizza was and it wasn't too heavy. The portions were perfect as well! We will defiantly be back!

Went to CPK for Mother's Day... Our server Lauren was amazing!!! The food was excellent. Got the Jerk Chicken Pizza which was spicy and the Wild Mushroom pizza both were delish. The five cheese pizza and Original BBQ pizza  halves were also great. Overall good drinks too.
The lunch menu is perfect. I ate pepperoni pizza with a Caesar salad , ice tea and chocolate soufflé with ice cream for dessert .  Jayna our waitress is awesome .
Garlic chicken and roasted veggies were perfectly cooked.  My taste buds were screaming with delight! The service was wonderful.  Jaws was a great server catering to our every need.

My daughter (1 1/2 yrs old) and I come here and have a lunch date once a week. I love this place and always request Joslyn. (Allan is great too!) 1. My daughter has severe food allergies (soy, fish, dairy and she is gluten sensitive due to a rare GI disorder) I get her the kids grilled chicken with grapes and a side of avocado. She has never had a reaction to their food (BIG plus for this mama) and the staff takes her allergies very serious and I am most appreciative of that. 2. We love to go to the park before lunch so its a bonus that VG has a little park and CPK is within such a short walking distance and I dont have to put her back in the carseat just to grab a bite. 3.Their great with my daughter (another big plus). They are extremely busy on weekends and most night, hence why we have a lunch date mid week in the afternoon (1ish). So be prepared to wait if you come on a Sunday afternoon. CPK gets very busy during summer as well, but you can always call ahead and see what the wait is and put your name on the list (but if you're not there when they call it you get bumped back down, so make sure you go as soon as you put your name on the list... It's not considered a reservation, just a call ahead). Overall I keep coming back because the price is right, food is good, and I can have my girl eat and be a stress free mama about allergies.
Great service! Was skeptical at first, since there was a game on today and I thought it might be busy. But I'm pleasantly surprised at the noise level and the food. Great experience overall

I love CPK! Especially their drinks and small bites. I'm obsessed with their Mac n cheese and tequila pasta... Their bbq chicken salad is also amazing!  Not a big fan of the pizzas though but I don't like pizza in general lol  I love coming to this location for a quick happy hour or lunch after a fun day of shopping.  Service is always on point!

We arrived at the Rancho Cucamonga location on a busy night and were told that it would be a twenty minute wait, which was understandable given our larger party which needed table accommodations. Our server, Jose, started off the night as seemingly attentive and we were excited to be at our first California Pizza Kitchen in quite a while.  However, things quickly took a turn for the worse. I noticed Jose would pass our table attending to other customers to check up on them, but he rarely stopped by our table. He was clearly busy and would say a short, "everything good here?" in passing, without allowing much time for us to respond. He never checked to see if our table needed water or additional bread, as we had to flag down another server who would respond in a much more appropriate manner.  When our food arrived, he haphazardly tried to hand us our plates, which I thought was extremely odd for any sort of dine-in experience. Why would he try to reach with his arms outstretched to hand a large plate with a pizza to someone sitting diagonally across from him? If the food was too hot, it would've presented a danger to my guests, and if they didn't have a firm grip, the food would have fallen. This is completely unacceptable behavior for any sort of server in the most standard of restaurants. Definitely not the type of service I expect from California Pizza Kitchen. Since our party was large, we wanted to have a total of two separate checks and when it came time to pay, he presented them to us in one folder, which made it very frustrating to pay with. When we asked for boxes for our leftovers, he came back with less than what we needed and no bags. Jose as a server overall was inattentive, careless, and slow. I do not know if this was an off night or if the restaurant was understaffed, but this made for an unpleasant experience to say the least. I doubt I will be returning to this location.

Can never go wrong with the Chopped BBQ chicken salad.  Always a great experience at all CPK's...consistent.  But the Victoria  Gardens  location staff is amazing!!!  The hostess Tori always welcomes us with a huge smile and genuine hospitality.  We will return again and again simply because of Tori's warm and welcoming "Hi There" as we walk in.

This place is always great whenever I come in!! My best friend and I love eating here whenever we come shopping. We especially loved our server today Michael he was suspect amazing and nice and funny !!!

Dined at the Victoria Gardens location today with my family. Always impressed by CPK and this location didn't disappoint. From our hospitable and happy welcome to our quick and efficient server greet this experience rocked! Our server Sidney ROCKED! The manager Larry stopped by and connected with my family and the rest of the staff was all smiles. Thank you CPK for a great time!

Will give a 0 stars, service good but food terrible,  worst than fast food.  I took my wife and granddaughter , she is only 2 years old and I asked my wife where she chose this horrible food place.  I ordered the Mahi Mahi Tacos worst tacos ever,  dry fish, flavorless cabbage etc, and we ordered chicken nuggets with baby broccoli for my little one, tried a piece and you can taste the grease on them and flavor was awful no wonder she would not eat them.   Pico de gallo is not fresh.
Loved the whole wheat crust chicken pizza. Great wine choices. Outstanding  customer service from my waitress, Brittany!!
Best service my family and I have ever had.  Alex thanks for taking care of us!  Started the weekend out right.

The staff here does not take substitutions well. I normally don't send things back to the kitchen but someone wasn't posting attention. Not only was my order messed up when the bill came I had to argue with the manager about being charged for substitutions that have never been a problem at other CPKs.

The food was awesome!  I ordered for pick up at 12:20pm for an office.  I didn't leave until 12:47. I was late for my customers most of whom missed having lunch because I was late.  When you screw up an order for 15 people then you have 15 people not happy with the restaurant and not just the one that paid for it!  I won't be back and neither will they.  The young man that put the order together was very polite and still got his full tip!  This was managements fault for not overseeing the kitchen.  Nor did he even apologize.  RUDE! Manager did call and try to make it right.

Four to six associates were huddled at the host stand at all times. Everyone was told there would be a 10 to 15 minute wait despite their party size. We all stood and miserably waited while looking at all the empty tables.  Once seated, our hostess was super attentive and efficient. Actually felt pretty bad for her as she seemed to be waiting all the tables in sight. Why schedule an entire football team to hang out at the host stand but not have enough servers to even utilize all tables. But who knows... Maybe all the servers called in sick.  Food was ... filling I guess? Here's what we ordered: Cheese pizza with tomatoes - 2.5/5  Chicken dumplings - 1/5 Guacamole with corn - 1/5  Chicken tequila pasta - 4/5  Out of everything we ordered, the only thing that tasted good was the pasta. Though the chicken was barely there, the taste made up for it.  Not sure why the place was busy. No plans of returning. I'd be happier with a bag of hot Cheetos and a Coke Zero for lunch.
My dude Lance Dylan. Awesome server.  Friendly as can be. If you have Lance as your waiter, be happy. Lance if you see this. We were the "kiddies" with our sundaes.  Thanks man.

Worst place to eat. Sat at a table for 20 minutes with no service while everyone around us was served. I believe we were discriminated on because we were the only Hispanic people in the restaurant. We walked out and will never visit another CPK. I would caution eating here.

Had the kung pao spaghetti and it was amazing, their  play on like a kung pao chow mein dish and it was superb  good job cpk!! My server was super attentive and we called in earlier for a reservation which I highly recommend on weekends

After growing up in California, finally tried the infamous CPK. I got the Carne Asada PIzza, which at first glance you're kind of skeptical but then you think about it and you're like "100% YES". It was crispy, hot and tasted delicious! My wife got the tostada pizza and it too was delicious. Pizzas alone get 5 stars! Took a star off since we were told it was a 10-15 minute wait time and ended up sitting there for 20-25 which is just annoying since Victoria Gardens is a beautiful place where we could have walked around if we were told the actual wait time. All in all i'd be super down to come back and try more pizza!

I was waiting 40 minutes to be seated only to find out that I apparently was not on the roster. I ordered the BBQ chicken pizza and it was pretty good but I don't think it was worth the $15. My server never came back to my table to ask if everything was okay or to give us refills, only to drop off the bill. Maybe it was just a bad day but I wouldn't come back.

My entree was fine; thx.  But..... One star for level of service... on this Thursday evening.  Note: 2nd time I've been here.. and they're out of bread! Really!? Weak! I watched my sever run back as forth... waiting for bread or entree (either one). After about ten minutes.... I saw the four loaves come out of the oven... still time would pass and no bread lol  The server shouts asking for bread status lol but I tell her about the "four." Lol  It came with my entree...ugh!  Let's go over what staffing ...  Managers on staff ...2  1 on the line...  the other fiddling in the rear of the kitchen doing who knows what...but eventually would surface to the bar only to spend "five minutes" trying to change the overhead flat screen?! Ugh!  Servers are over-sat... patrons get sucky service!  One bartender assigned to drinks for the entire restaurant, while "waiting"/serving the full bar (about 16) & all the five surrounding high top tables  full of patrons having dinner! Really?!  Again... service sucked tonight.. and two mgr on duty! Wth!?

You're walking around Rancho Cucamonga one day and decided "Hey, lets get some food!" and your friend's like "Yeah!" and I'm like "Yeah!" and we walked in and then the waiter's like "For 2?" and we're like "Yeah!" and he's all "Yeah! Here's your seat!" and we're like "Yeah!". Then my friend asked me if we should share the pizza and order our own separate meal to gain some weight just because and I'm like "Yeah!" and the waiter's like "You ready to order?" and we're like "Yeah!" and Yelp readers are like "Yeah, this guy's taking advantage of Prop 64" and I'll be "Yeah!" Our food came and we're like "Yeah!" and the food wanted to be eaten so hard it smells like Yeah! The food & service was great and gave the waiter a handsome tip and he was like "Yeah!" and we're all "Yeah!". The pizza is better than the chicken, then again, it is a pizza restaurant. Yeah.

I get that we came on a Friday night and we are a group of 8, but we have been waiting over an hour because they told us the table they want to put us at is occupied. Instead of pushing tables together to accommodate us, they have decided to make us wait for a single table for larger groups...the party sitting there has their bill and had already been here 2 hours, but it's more important to make them happy and not accommodate our party and not push tables together. I'd leave if I was on my own, but my party is starving and we've already waited this long.

We have been to this location many times without any issue.  This last time the service was horrible.  From the moment we walked in, the hostess who was with her head down looking at the hand held pad of the restaurant did not even great us with a hello or a I will be right with you or apologize for her  delay( I sensed attitude) Just how many?  and turned us over to the seating hostess.  Well that set the tone for the rest of the time there.  We sat and waited, never once did anyone say we will be right with you. Just saw workers in all sorts of different directions.  Finally after a few minutes our waitress came and took care of us. I understand with the holidays it can be busy but a little service here.  The gentleman who brought our food out was very polite and took care of us and made sure we did not need anything else.  I expect good customer service, get the people you need so your workers are not over tasked.  This will translate to good customer service.

They can be a bit busy, which is understandable since they are in the center of Victoria Gardens. The waiting sometimes can be long as well. It would be nice to have more seatings in the front area while we wait. I know we can wait outside but we can't go anywhere far. Other than the waiting, the food is delicious. I love their pizza. Artichoke dip isn't too impressive but it was good. My boyfriend and I always eat outside because it's quieter. They greeted us nicely and the waiters are nice as well. I would recommend to try the mushroom pizza!

The service was excellent. We got the avocado rolls for an appetizer, which were really good. I've always thought that their pizza is just OK, which is how I felt about it this time. So excellent service and appetizer, but not as good pizza.

Always nice to hit up this place when it is not busy.  Nice servers, delicious pizzas, enough beverage selection.  LOVED how they make the RIBEYE steak here.  @Flemmings - at the mall entrance - should come over an learn how to prepare a proper steak. $48 dollars and I just wanted to throw the piece of sh*t back at the kitchen!  California Pizza Kitchen's ribeye is half that price and just perfect.

We come to this location at least every few months and never seem to be disappointed. Tonight I called to see how long the wait was for a party of 5 and they told me 45-50min so I checked in over the phone. We arrived just about 50 min in and were seated right away. We are literally in and out within an hour and the food was great, no complaints!

So let me just say I have no complaints about the food. I've been going to CPK for years and the one thing I can say is that the food is consistently good. I usually go to the Chino Hills location but this time I was meeting a friend in Rancho so there I was. The problem is with the bill. I honestly almost NEVER check my bill and maybe that's my own fault but I trust the check to be right. This time however I figured $105 is a bit much for 2 dinners and 2 drinks. When I checked the bill I saw they had charged for an extra drink and an entire dish I never ordered. How the heck did that happen? I told the waiter It's a good thing I checked and he replied Yes it's a good thing you did. Isn't that their job NOT to overcharge me??? I think every time a restaurant overcharges a customer and they get caught they should take an item off the bill. Anyways folks always check your bill. I am petrified to think how many hundreds of dollars I have been paying for food I never ordered. Lesson Learned!!!!

Came here for lunch after church... AMAZING! Our server Michael was wonderful, helped us with some suggestions and was very attentive to make sure we always had enough drink and complimentary bread. My husband got the Carne Asada/BBQ 1/2 and 1/2 pizza. Both were so yummy. I got the Quinoa + Arugula salad and it was great, perfect amount of dressing, so fresh. Delicious yumminess
Nae and Sami are awesome and super friendly. They are the reason I will be coming back. Plus the delicious food and drinks.

I used to come here quite often when I worked at the mall and I love their roasted vegetable salad. I wanted something fresh and healthy today so I decided to call in two salads and I added chicken to both (one for my sister) and we also put in an order for avocado egg rolls.  They took my order as soon as I called and they told me my order would be ready in about 15-20 minutes. I went to pick it up 20 minutes after and they were busy which I expect for a Sunday afternoon.  I went to the back of the bar to pick up my order and I stood there for almost 10 mins before the bartender asked me if I had been helped. Several employees walked past me and saw me looking around and did not say one word to me. I told her I was picking up an order and she asked me to give her a minute. I waited about 6-7 more minutes and she just disappeared. Finally another employee approached me and asked me if I had been helped and I told her I've been waiting for almost 20 minutes and I just want to pick up my order.  She said it wasn't her section but she would help me. Literally she just had to ring me up. No apology for the wait or anything. Clearly specular service isn't expected for a simple take out order but I don't expect to wait 20 minutes with employees staring at me and not saying one word.  The only reason I am giving 2 stars instead of 1 is because the food was still really good.

Service was just Terrible, our Salad was not good and our drinks came after 25 minutes, the Pizza was not good, I was better off getting a frozen pizza, but what top it off even more was our service, she was Terrible!! Never going back and I don't recommend at all!!! Mary you were Terrible, worst service ever!!!!
I would rather eat the grass off of my front lawn and have a frozen pizza then go back to California pizza kitchen and have their pizza and salad!!!
Awesome!!! Great tasting pizza! It's so fresh too! They have an sweet manager too that greeted us and celebrated our first visit with us. So nice!

The manager Jen is absolutely amazing. It's awesome that even though this is a huge change establishment the managers are as personable as Jen is. She made sure our meal was great and personally got us anything we needed. Totally blown away by the service. Not to mention this food is phenomenal and incredibly fresh as well. Thanks CPK Victoria Gardens

So far horrible...Given a wait time 15-20 minutes...Noting  11 tables open....Slow as heck...Staff who sat us had a name tag who read SHAGGY (unprofessional)...Server MARY was extremely nice...Hoping the food is worth  the wait...They just brought free bread...Its looking a oil better...Still not sold...Will keep ya posted...I posted earlier a 1  but after the attention we received from MARY and the manager will are happy campers....

Have been coming to this location since it has opened.  Have met some great people who have become friends.  Sat at the bar with Mary today and got great service as usual.  Always enjoy talking to Mary with her bubbly, outgoing personality.  Servers like Mary are hard to find.  She's a keeper!!!

The food took about 25 min to come . I ordered kung poe chicken pasta ,it was a huge plate with very small portion of food. Food does not cost that much money just add the portion like cheese cake fatory they are really generous (big portion ) .I don't think I will go back here again .I love my cheese cake fatory.

Had a great experience here! It was busy but our server Cassandra was such a great help to our hunger needs! She looked stressed with more tables to cover then what she should of had which could of been an employee calling out, BUT she took  initiative to be the best that she could be for us and I appreciate that! Ask for Cassandra , she was the best customer service while dinning I could ever hope for! Thank you!!!
Food was great for me but not for my boyfriend. But I'm not rating it on food. I'm rating it on service.. our waitress was not very attentive. I kind of felt like she forgot about us.

Absolutely HORRIBLE service!!! Save your time and money. Went in to order a SINGLE pizza and waited 45 minutes before deciding that was too long even during a rush (which it wasn't). Went to ask the person for how much more of a wait and they had no idea what I was talking about. NEVER PUT IT IN MY ORDER. So they go get a manager who then comes out to tell me "We're in a bit of a pickle here..we're out of the pizza you want". No offer for something else, no offer to comp a pizza or discount it. Nothing. A complete waste of my time and caused me unnecessary frustration. I won't be back and I hope those people waste a frustrated hour of their life that they never get back.
I love CPK and I LOVE this location! Always receive the best service and quality of food is excellent. The servers are also so friendly and we have so much fun every time we go!

CPK. Usually my favorite place for gluten free pizza. This trip however was just a quick stop for a glass of vino.  The bar tenders were friendly and the always remember us.  Nice atmosphere and good wine.

Had a lunch date with my wife!  I looked up closest CPK and saw this one. Only had 3 stars and read some of the comments and decided to come anyways! I rated 5 starts because great food, great service! Cassie did a great job and made sure to come by the table and ask if we need anything! (Always with a refill) Thank you CPK!

We had a great time and meal. It was our first visit to CPK and we were served by Mike G. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave some great recommendations about what to eat. When we told him if was our first visit to CPK he told the manager Allen who brought over a FREE flatbread appetizer. Mike checked in on us several times but he wasnt pushy with his service. We ordered a carne asada pizza and strawberry mango coolers. Both were excellent. Very clean place with excellent service. We will be going back again.

Come here often and I consider myself a CPK expert at this point.  It's my family's go to spot.  The pasta bolognese is my son's must have dinner entree....man size!  (Adult portion). He loves it - great flavor and apparently my husband likes it too....he sneaks bites when our son isn't looking...hence the man size portion.  The Italian chopped salad is great and the portions are huge.  My daughter and I split it along with a Margherita pizza.  Thin crust, perfect flavor - we ask for extra fresh basil. My husband gets the tequila lime chicken pasta - he loves the cream sauce.   They have great sangria- and even have a sangria sampler.  We started with the sampler to figure out which of the three is our favorite and now just order our favs.  It's a better price and you get more in one large glass than 3 small sample sizes.  My favorite is the orchard sangria.  Light, refreshing and addictive!!  I tried their butter cake this past week...omg - amazing!!!  This is going to be a problem now that I know how awesome it tastes.  See you next week, CPK!

First of all I'd like to say this review is based of customer service experience.   Went out to dinner with family , requested a booth but unable to accommodate,  so got a table.  Then waited over 20 minutes for drinks , and to top it all off when waitress brought bill she lost my ATM, had to wait til staff looked all over for my card. All the while asking if I put It in my purse. Waited an additional 30 minutes as they looked like chicken without heads.  Finally the dishwasher boy found it behind the dishes.  They were apologetic but need to be very careful with people's belonging. I thought I was going to have to cancel my card. Morons need to be careful.

Our waitress (who's name I believe is Kayla) was amazing!! She had such a great attitude and had my entire family excited to dig into their entrees. She is definitely a great waitress, and she made my family's night at CPK for Father's Day one to remember :)

This rating is for service. I can't rate the food because we walked out.  I should've guessed there was a problem when we walked into a mostly empty restaurant @ 545 today and the hostesses couldn't decide where to seat us (party of 2.) After being seated we were told that someone would be with us shortly.  8 minutes later and we have not been approached by our server, which is difficult to understand since there are servers all over the place chatting with each other and walking around. At the 10 minute mark I flagged down the hostess & asked about our server. She walked over & talked to someone & then Mark came to take our drink order. We then sat there waiting . . .& waiting . . . & waiting.  Then my daughter noticed that our server was talking with several other servers instead of getting our drink order. That's when we walked out. Grrrrr. I have *never* had such a bad experience at a restaurant. My daughter was looking forward to trying CPK pizza, but we won't be returning anytime soon.

I hardly come to CPK since they took one of my favorite sandwiches off their menu but every now and then I will come to get their famous BBQ Chicken pizza! It's the best, even though I'm not really a fan of thin crust pizza's. For some reason it really works with this particular pizza flavor. This location is always busy since it is located in Victoria Gardens so be prepared for a wait. At least with it being located with shops you can browse around while you wait to be called. They do give you a buzzer so you can't really go far. It would be helpful if they adapted the call out system where it texts your phone so you can wander around the nearby shops.  The service is pretty decent here. When I visited the waitress was pretty attentive. I forgot her name or else I would include it in my review. As mentioned previously I really only get their BBQ Chicken pizza. But I have tried their fried Mac and cheese appetizer before and it is delicious! Their salads are also pretty big too so if you're into eating healthy you can always opt for one of their salad options.  For dessert I would choose their butter cake. It's nice and moist. Delicious!  Overall I give them 4 stars for good food and decent service!
CPK is always great.  There are always new, seasonal items on the menu.  The pizzas are unique and delicious and some of the other favorites (Chinese Chicken Salad?) are always a treat!

We had lunch here today and it was a great experience.  Cassidy was our server and she was very sweet and attentive. The pizza was delicious as well. I was surprised but they have more than just pizza on their menu, which is good. Salads looked delicious as I saw servers walking by with them, I may try one next time.

Came here for lunch today and felt to leave a review because of the wonderful service we received. First of all, the food was delicious. I highly recommend getting the buffalo cauliflower bites. They are better than Buffalo chicken bites from other places. We also had the seasonal summer salad with strawberries and watermelon. The salad was amazing, very light and yet very filling. The manager came by to check on us a couple of times and also made a point to remind me to use my rewards. Whenever I go in, I always forget that I signed up for a rewards card there so I was grateful he reminded me and we were able to get a free appetizer. Our waitress was great as well. Overall, definitely the best service of all the CPKs I've been to. We will definitely be back.

Second visit here, I really enjoy the 1/2 Grilled Veggie Salad with Chicken!! Full of flavor!! Can't go wrong here.  Amazing and friendly waitress !  We're CPK members so we receive 20% off our check on a return visit!!  So here we are reaping our benefits!  Haha!!
I love this place. Not only is pizza amazing, but this pizza is amazing! I love coming here. Staff are also super friendly!

CPK has tasty food but prices are high and they don't post drink prices on their menus.   So you order a drink and then are slammed with outrageous prices!  Don't understand how they can not post prices.

Honestly one of the best customer experiences i've ever had. I'm really into customer service from my last job and Alex our waiter did a great job. It was our first time and we only got a 25$ meal with a gift card and we were still treated great. We got a sample of some sort of bread for free and that was awesome. The beer came cold with a lime and a nice mug to pour it in. Our pizza was delicious. Had to say great job and thank you! :)

My boyfriend and I had a wonderful lunch date at this CPK. The only negative thing I have to say was that the two hostesses didn't greet us when we walked in - they made us wait while they finished their conversation before acknowledging us. Not the best first impression, but it was all uphill from there. The inside of the restaurant is clean, bright, and modern. Our waiter was fabulous throughout the whole meal. He gave me great advice when I was choosing a pizza and even said that if I didn't like it, he would gladly bring me something else. I ordered a sangria flight and the Chipotle Chicken pizza. The sangria flight came with three variations of sangria and each was more delicious than the next. They were on the very sweet side but I personally love sweet drinks, so I enjoyed them a lot. I was a bit skeptical about ordering a very non-traditional pizza. However, I ended up loving the Chipotle Chicken pizza so much I ate the whole thing! Topped with corn, poblano peppers, black beans, chicken, and more, it was definitely different but very delicious. It was served with a side of cilantro crema that perfectly complemented the other flavors of the pizza. Wonderful meal and (mostly) wonderful service!

The reason I love coming here so much is because they support Leo's and usually their fundraisers apply to more than one location. Their food is pretty good, service has always been good. The times I've gone parking has never been that bad and the place is always clean. I also like how you could order food as take out.  Today I got the lunch special with a half turkey sandwich and a bowel of baked potato soup. The sandwich was really good with the apples and dressing while the baked potato soup didn't disappoint either. I also recommend getting their cucumber reviver which is really refreshing during these hot days!

The food is good and always has been. The problem I have is the cost!!!!! I took my family of 4 to dinner and the bill for (2) salads and (3) pizzas and a kids pizza was over $80 and sorry I forgot the (2) $ 3.25 soft drinks,not counting the tip. I think I will just got to Costco and get 2 large pizzas for $22 no tip required. Pizza is Fantastic at Costco. You don't need to be a member to buy the food from the food court

Well, I haven't been to a CPK in years but my friends and I decided to give it a try. I love Sangria and was very excited to try the sangria flight (little glasses with about 3 oz of each flavor they offer) Well I ordered it and didn't get it until I was almost finished with my meal. The waiter said it was because "they couldn't find any little glasses" which was odd because the restaurant was pretty empty and I didn't see it on any other table. My pizza was delicious, but i think it's really strange that they don't offer as many different pizzas as they used to. Other than that the portions are really small compared to the price.

I love ALL California Pizza Kitchen. Their food is so delicious. (mostly the Pizza and Salads are the best!) ... However, the service here was a-okay. Our waitress was either forgetful, or careless, or both!  I asked for water, with NO ice. I got a cup full of ice.  THEN, I asked for a salad WITH avocado. I got my salad with NO avocado.  So, with that being said... I still had a great time with my friends and hubby.  and yes, I will be back!

We had a really sweet waitress tonight  She got our picky orders perfect.  She was super friendly and all smiles  We always appreciate great service. Thank you Alexis Dinner was good and the service even better. We will request you the next time we come in.

I need to give a shout out to the amazing employees of CPK Victoria Gardens for excellent care and hospitality. When dining there this evening, my two year old son unexpectedly started to projectile vomit. He had just climbed into my lap so I was basically head to toe in throw up and he was too. The manger Joselyn, stepped up with damp towels, brought bags for his clothing and even helped wiped my son down herself while I was trying to clean up. After we finally got somewhat decent I asked for our check. Joselyn then comped our bill and wrapped up my sons food to go. The service we experienced was definitely above and beyond. I am so thankful for their help and we will be back soon.

Came in this past sunday at 2pm for a birthday lunch with my daughter. (she picked it, i had never been) party of 5 i approached the hostess and was told the wait would be about 30mins. ok, i put my name down and we waited about 15mins, not so bad. Our waiter let us know he would be a minute he was pretty busy. He came and took our order, i was saddened to learn they did not have brunch but i ordered a Mimosa anyways.
